ukm:Metadata.dc:title: Foreign National Offenders (Exclusion from the United Kingdom) Bill
ukm:Metadata.dc:creator: Parliamentary Counsel

CoverPara.Text: Explanatory notes to the Bill, prepared by the [Name to be replaced], are published separately as ...
[Name to be replaced] has made the following statement under section 19(1)(a) of the Human Rights Act 1998:
In my view the provisions of the Foreign National Offenders (Exclusion from the United Kingdom) Bill are compatible with the Convention rights.

Para.Text: Make provision to make provision to exclude from the United Kingdom foreign nationals found guilty of a criminal offence committed in the United Kingdom.

Be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows:—

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State must make provision in regulations for any foreign national convicted in any court of law of a qualifying offence to be excluded from the United Kingdom.

P3para.Text: the removal of an individual excluded under subsection (1) from the United Kingdom, where this is not already provided for in law,
the removal of any right to remain in the United Kingdom from an individual excluded under subsection (1), and
measures to prevent an individual excluded under subsection (1) from entering the United Kingdom.

P2para.Text: Regulations under this section shall be—

P3para.Text: may not be made unless a draft has been laid before and approved by resolution of either House of Parliament.

Para.Text: “any court of law” shall mean any court of law within the United Kingdom,
“foreign national” shall mean a person who is not a British citizen,
“qualfying offence” shall mean any offence for which a term of imprisonment may be imposed by a court of law.

P2para.Text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign National Offenders (Exclusion from the United Kingdom) Act 2013.
This Act comes into force on whatever day the Secretary of State appoints by order made by statutory instrument.
